intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum var. columnae, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in umbels. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
